comments.author: u310142@disabled.tld
comments.creator: u310142@disabled.tld
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13
Build Identifier: 4.0b11pre

Scrolled text uses greyscale AA. After about 3 seconds of scrolling inactivity it switches to sub-pixel AA until it is scrolled again.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
Example:
1. Open the web console
2. Load or reload a page
3.
Actual Results:  
Greyscale AA. After about 3 seconds it switches to sub-pixel AA until it scrolls again.

Expected Results:  
Subpixel AA all the time.

Using D2D, D3D10 layers and DirectWrite on a 9600M GT with 266.58 drivers.
comments.raw_text:

comments.text: We've seen other people who have this problem. I think we should look into fixing it.

comments.creator: asa@mozilla.com
comments.text: I will do what ever I can to help debug this. I'm seeing it in tab title text, and in content on twitter. All on windows 7 with all the hardware accel features enabled.
comments.author: asa@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: I will do what ever I can to help debug this. I'm seeing it in tab title text, and in content on twitter. All on windows 7 with all the hardware accel features enabled.

comments.creator: roc@ocallahan.org
comments.text:
Tab title text I know about.

Web content, I don't know. A minimal testcase would be useful, and a layer tree dump --- use a debug build, set MOZ_DUMP_PAINT_LIST=1 in the environment.
comments.author: roc@ocallahan.org
comments.raw_text:
Tab title text I know about.

Web content, I don't know. A minimal testcase would be useful, and a layer tree dump --- use a debug build, set MOZ_DUMP_PAINT_LIST=1 in the environment.

comments.author: roc@ocallahan.org
comments.raw_text: Can you give a link to twitter content that shows grayscale AA? Actually grayscale AA in Web content should really go under a separate bug. The issues about Web Console (and possibly other scrollable chrome UI) are separate from any issues with Web content.
comments.creator: roc@ocallahan.org
comments.text: Can you give a link to twitter content that shows grayscale AA? Actually grayscale AA in Web content should really go under a separate bug. The issues about Web Console (and possibly other scrollable chrome UI) are separate from any issues with Web content.

comments.author: Virtual@teknik.io
comments.raw_text:
It should be fixed starting from Mozilla Firefox 52 per:
- Skia being enabled by default(Windows - bug #1007702, Linux - bug #1278957, Mac - bug #1207332)
- bug #1303570 (leftovers will be tracked in bug #1307833).

Duping this bug to bug #1307833 to later easier tracking, instead of incomplete or worksforme.
comments.creator: Virtual@teknik.io
comments.text:
It should be fixed starting from Mozilla Firefox 52 per:
- Skia being enabled by default(Windows - bug #1007702, Linux - bug #1278957, Mac - bug #1207332)
- bug #1303570 (leftovers will be tracked in bug #1307833).

Duping this bug to bug #1307833 to later easier tracking, instead of incomplete or worksforme.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 1307833 ***
Using Skia doesn't magically make us use sub-pixel where we were using grayscale AA. Please test this before concluding that it's fixed.
